title: Is this a viable new strategy? Five Tank Lane?
body:
Tanky ADC (Graves, Urgot)
Tanky Support (Leona, Braum)
Tanky Mid (Cho'Gath?)
Tanky Top (Nasus, Riven?)
Tanky Jungle (Elise, Sejuani, every other jungler except lee sin)

Have the entire team build the new ZZrot Portal as their second item or so, and when laning phase nears its end, have all 5 portals placed in one lane. Grief the crap out of the enemy team by defending those portals with your tanky selves. When they're forced to extend to take out the portals, close in on targets of opportunity and force them to back or die.

If you're really lucky, they will try to send someone through the jungle to take out the portals from the side, over the walls. that should be an easy kill if you have wards up.

But then I might be overestimating the tanky stats of the new item.

Leo/Graves bot lane is infamously strong. Riven is not a tank, nor does she really siege too well, she's more all in; Mundo or Maokai would probably be better. There are also better tank junglers than Elise and Sejuani; Nautilus is incredibly tanky, for example. For mid laners; Ryze is gutted right now (pending rework), but he was a decent tankier mid laner, you might also be able to play like Mordekaiser or Galio or Vladmir.

I think it'll be better if you choose, rather than 5 tanky champions, pick just a sieging composition. The problem with just letting voidlings take turrets though is that they just get countered by waveclear.

The strategy could probably work, but I don't think it's optimal or really efficient.

EDIT: Just tested the item out in a few AI games real quick; the range on the minions is pretty short, and they aggro/target select in a very strange way, where if you put them in the jungle they might go to an unintended lane for whatever reason. You constantly have to move the spawner up if you want to contest objectives; I think the most useful is to get like, lvl 9 on Singed, go RoA and ZZ'Rot and boots and maybe upgraded trinket ward so you can ward jungle and stuff, put the spawner between turrets while you proxy, that way you can still protect the spawner (with your fling) and I think if you place the spawner correctly, you can take both turrets if you place the spawner well (haven't been able to test this for T1 and T2 turrets since the proxy farm took the T1 turret before I got the items, but it seemed like it kind of worked for T2/T3 turrets). I don't know if the item is core or really necessary on any champion, but it's pretty fun to use.

This strategy sounds hilarious and I'll bet you could win matches with it. X) I can't help but think if you used a beefy pusher or two specifically the Portals would be even more effective; something like Trundle or Sejuani or even a late game Nasus. Somebody could split push while the rest of the team presses into another lane with a 4 man + portals push or something.

Riven is not tanky in the least, she stacks AD and Arpen.

About stacking Zz'rots, yes it gives powerful bursts of pushing power, but any team with a potent AOE clearer in the form of a mage or an AD caster with Hydra can clear them out pretty fast if they pay attention to when your team drops them all.

Thing is, these voidlings do a lot of damage to towers, but they've. I'd think it would be a lot more viable to run 2 on good clearing high escape characters, like Mundo and Singed, and have them push two lanes while the other three push the third lane. Mundo/Singed clears the waves, the voidlings damage the tower. 

In general, you could say that your strat is putting all your eggs in one basket. Might be funny to work once, but any weakness is going to be exploited easily.

As far as I know ZZrot portal spawns are ignoring champs and exploding under tower. 

That means that they can only push so if enemy team has god wave clearer they only get more gold if you put these portals on one lane.

I have not tested the new item but wouldn't something like...

Heimer + Banner
4x tanky champs with decent ranged AoE, preferably, and some CC to create portals (4x) and force enemies back from tower long enough for heimer to put down a few turrets + get a few voids on the tower via the AoE/CC forcing back opponents.

Perhaps one player puts a portal in another lane and helps split push or have a Yi or someone split push to pull aggro from enemy team and increase odds of success.

Can the portals be placed in base and go to the nearest lane so that they are completely safe from being harmed? What about including multiple Ohmwrecker on the tanks to really hard engage or force back on tower and in the meantime Heimer + turrets + voids wreck tower and maybe another lane?

Perhaps throw in a heavy AoE AP harass champion to help heimer force enemies back while turrets + voids wreck towers and only 2-3 tanks (depending if an extra non-tank pushing another lane or whatever) aids in keeping enemies back from tower? Could rotate Ohmwrecker every couple of seconds between CD periods which also gives you an excuse to get out so tower doesn't have heat build too much.

How does Banner interact with the void and is it worth while? What about also getting Lich on Heimer and maybe the AP ranged AoE harass champion helping to also aid in downing towers? Grab multiple barrier/heals because forcing the enemy to ONLY engage on your terms early-mid to late game because you ONLY push down lanes could make this summoner combo viable (mix it up a bit to cover any weak points or add to strat as necessary).

Could putting a bunch of these portals + heimer biding time on a tower or a split pusher (in multiple lanes forcing the enemy to split) bide enough time to easily grab Baron uncontested? What about with teleport on everyone? Baron + Banner + Voids + Heimer turrets on top of everything else? What about the elixer to boost tower dmg?

me and four friends did this in normals today.

Vladimir Mid
